entry.title: Combined summary - User coordination of soft fork activation
entry.summary: Martin has proposed a plan to improve UASFs (User Activated Soft Forks) with the use of smart contracts. The proposal aims to incentivize users to enforce the soft fork while ensuring that a significant part of the economy agrees to it and reducing the risk of support being too low. The contract would signal the intention to miners and other users, making it expensive for sybil attackers. Additionally, Martin suggests a unique way to pay developers for the development of the soft fork code. The document is timestamped in transaction 05d5eabcf77964a1e5a704175ef2e54f1fe243ed7aad0a80ede47845173bd2e5 in block 0000000000000000002f4b63ee720958da187405bb807466177be8da2c6ad3b6. Interested parties can review the proposal at the GitHub link provided by Martin.
